Articles.Content: In a tail-sitter plane at the island airfield. He's just one of 38 currently assigned kerbals. Bill and Bob are in a shuttle docked to Waystation Kerbin.
He screwed up when transferring a station to Jool, and now he and nine others are lost somewhere way out of the sun's SOE.
Stuck in a crashed lander on Duna. Resuce Mission is underway!
On his way with Bob, Bill and three scientists to Moho.

Rescue was successful, but Jeb's next mssion took him to Duna where a hard landing voided his ship's guarantee and left him stranded. He's found an old science rover that has been gathering Duna dust for years and is having fun rebuilding it into a dune buggy.

A couple of years later, Jeb's flying a tanker/rescue ship around Dres to routinely rescue other Kerbonauts. He's very good at this because he has unmatched experience at getting rescued.

My Jeb is dead. He managed the first successful orbit of Kerbin, but stayed up too long and ran out of electric power during the descent. His pod came in facing the completely wrong way, and burned up in the atmosphere.

(TAC Life Support and Deadly Re-entry mods contributed to his death.)
Orbiting Dres with some friends
My Jeb is currently very lonely in a space station core I decided to scrap shortly after launching. I need to send up a mission to recover him and then de-orbit the station core.
First test flight, the staging was wrong and the resulting parachute opening destroyed the chute and then the capsule exploded into Kerbin, Jeb is dead.

On exile at the island airport alongside Bill and Bob.

They are being monitored by an unmanned fighter.
He's in captain's seat of the ~200ton Shai-Hulud spacecraft scheduled to burn towards Duna as soon as enough fuel is supplied, and expected to be commanding the mission to Jool next (probably).
Sitting around in a Ike orbit whit Bill, Bob and Chuck in the now outdated IPV Valcurie (Carrier Mode tend do do that) waiting for a launch window.

I was afraid he had been lost in a terrible accident, but last night I discovered he was residing on Mun. He had made a successful landing, but there was not enough fuel to return. Therefore I decided he needed to be returned. So I started a mission to bring him back. However my multi-seat rescue lander was under designed and didn't make a successful landing. Later I discovered I already had a lander orbiting Mun that is more than capable of landing and returning, so that is my mission tonight. Bring home Jebediah.
Dead. Jeb's dead, baby.
My Jeb commands a space station in LKO. Probably I got tired of his crazy landings so I sent him to a safer place...
Drifting around the Mun, My lander was ill equipped, so left em drifting in orbit, cant be bothered to bring them home

I decided that after dozens of successful flights (please read as surviving long enough), he would captain the kerbin space station. He's currently orbiting 200km above kerbin.

Edited January 17, 2014 by Jijonbreaker
He crashed into Laythe and got stranded, funnily enough only a few feet from where I stranded Bill and Bob as well

He was bravely taking on the first manned mission to achieve a stable LKO. He managed to successfully establish an orbit at around 80.000 km. Using his onboard devices, he was able to send large amounts of EVA reports to KSC. Using the rest of his fuel, he did a retrograde burn which led his vessel to a trajectory ending in kerbal ocean waters.

Unfortunatelly, the deployed parachute, even though fired at the altitude of 20.000km was apparently not enough to slow down the capsule enough. It crashed into the ocean with the force of a thousand suns (around 10m/s). The capsule blew up, the emergency teams where not able to recover any leftovers.

On the bright side, there have been no reports of a dead kerbonaut washed ashore on any of the observed continents. Being an old lone wolve, who knows? This legend of a kerbonaut might have been able to survive somehow. I guess we'll find out in time ... he might just show up at the KSC kerbonaut recruitment facility once he makes his way back to the KSC ...
Actually, sitting in the kerbonaut building at KSC complex. Too many unkerballed missions lately made him a bored kerbal xD

Jeb is Currently on the International Kerbal-Station in Low Orbit over the Kerbal Home world. Both him and his 6 other Kerbal buddies, including Bill and Bob, are doing very important experiments, such as playing pool in space, and on their off time, playing KSP
My Jeb is retired and is currently testing bombs, his favorite!
My Jeb is floating off inside my data on my old computer wondering if he can just reach the file over to his right.
Jeb is atm watching Duna trough the window in the lander part of the Magellan Mle 2 Exploration Ship.
